parameters.name: AutoPay
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to automatically complete the payment. Valid values:

1.  **true**: automatically completes the payment. You must make sure that your account balance is sufficient.
2.  **false**: does not automatically complete the payment. An unpaid order is generated.

> The default value is true. If your account balance is insufficient, you can set AutoPay to false to generate an unpaid order. Then, you can pay for the order in the ApsaraDB RDS console.

parameters.name: BackupId
parameters.description:
The backup set ID.

You can call the DescribeBackups operation to query the backup set ID.

>  You must specify at least one of the **BackupId** or **RestoreTime** parameters.

parameters.name: BackupType
parameters.description:
The type of backup that is used to restore the data of the original instance. Valid values:

*   **FullBackup**
*   **IncrementalBackup**

parameters.name: BpeEnabled
parameters.description: A reserved parameter. You do not need to specify this parameter.

parameters.name: BurstingEnabled
parameters.description: A reserved parameter. You do not need to specify this parameter.

parameters.name: Category
parameters.description:
The RDS edition of the instance. Valid values:

*   **Basic**: RDS Basic Edition.
*   **HighAvailability**: RDS High-availability Edition.
*   **AlwaysOn**: RDS Cluster Edition for ApsaraDB RDS for SQL Server.
*   **cluster**: RDS Cluster Edition for ApsaraDB RDS for MySQL.
*   **Finance**: RDS Enterprise Edition. This edition is available only on the China site (aliyun.com).

**Serverless instances**

*   **serverless_basic**: RDS Basic Edition. This edition is available only for serverless instances that run MySQL and PostgreSQL.
*   **serverless_standard**: RDS High-availability Edition for ApsaraDB RDS for MySQL
*   **serverless_ha**: RDS High-availability Edition for ApsaraDB RDS for SQL Server

>  You do not need to configure this parameter. The value of this parameter is the same as that of the original instance.

parameters.name: DBInstanceClass
parameters.description:
The instance type of the new instance. For information, see [Primary ApsaraDB RDS instance types](~~26312~~).

> By default, the new instance uses the same instance type as the original primary instance.

parameters.name: DBInstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID.

parameters.name: DBInstanceStorage
parameters.description:
The storage capacity of the new instance. Unit: GB. You can increase the storage capacity in increments of 5 GB. For more information, see [Primary ApsaraDB RDS instance types](~~26312~~).

> By default, the new instance has the same storage capacity as the original primary instance.

parameters.name: DBInstanceStorageType
parameters.description:
The storage type of the instance. Valid values:

*   **local_ssd**: local SSDs
*   **cloud_ssd**: standard SSDs
*   **cloud_essd**: enhanced SSDs (ESSDs) of performance level 1 (PL1)
*   **cloud_essd2**: ESSDs of PL2
*   **cloud_essd3**: ESSD of PL3

> Serverless instances support only ESSDs of PL 1. For a serverless instance, you must set this parameter to **cloud_essd**.

parameters.name: DbNames
parameters.description: The name of the database. If you specify more than one database, the value is in the following format: `Original database name 1,Original database name 2`.

parameters.name: DedicatedHostGroupId
parameters.description: The ID of the dedicated cluster.

parameters.name: DeletionProtection
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to enable the release protection feature for the instance. Valid values:

*   **true**: enables the feature.
*   **false** (default): disables the feature.

parameters.name: InstanceNetworkType
parameters.description:
The network type of the new instance. Valid values:

*   **VPC**
*   **Classic**

> By default, the new instance has the same network type as the original primary instance.

parameters.name: PayType
parameters.description:
The billing method of the instance. Valid values:

*   **Postpaid**: pay-as-you-go.
*   **Prepaid**: subscription.
*   **Serverless**: serverless. This value is not supported for instances that run MariaDB. For more information, see [Overview of serverless ApsaraDB RDS for MySQL instances](~~411291~~), [Overview of serverless ApsaraDB RDS for SQL Server instances](~~604344~~), and [Overview of serverless ApsaraDB RDS for PostgreSQL instances](~~607742~~).

parameters.name: Period
parameters.description:
The unit that is used to calculate the billing cycle of the new instance. Valid values:

*   **Year**
*   **Month**

> If you set the PayType parameter to **Prepaid**, you must also specify this parameter.

parameters.name: PrivateIpAddress
parameters.description: The internal IP address of the new instance, which must be within the CIDR block supported by the specified vSwitch. The system automatically assigns an internal IP address based on the values of the **VPCId** and **VSwitchId** parameters.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description: The region ID. You can call the DescribeRegions operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: RestoreTable
parameters.description: Specifies whether to restore only the databases and tables that you specify. The value **1** specifies to restore only the specified databases and tables. If you do not want to restore only the specified databases or tables, you do not need to specify this parameter.

parameters.name: RestoreTime
parameters.description:
The point in time to which you want to restore data. The point in time must fall within the specified backup retention period. Specify the time in the ISO 8601 standard in the *yyyy-MM-dd*T*HH:mm:ss*Z format. The time must be in UTC.

> You must specify at least one of the **BackupId** and **RestoreTime** parameters.

parameters.name: ServerlessConfig
parameters.description: The configuration of the serverless instance. You must specify this parameter only when you restore data to a new serverless instance.

parameters.name: TableMeta
parameters.description: The information about the database and table that you want to restore. The value is in the following format: `[{"type":"db","name":"Name of Database 1","newname":"New name of Database 1","tables":[{"type":"table","name":"Name of Table 1 in Database 1","newname":"New name of Table 1"},{"type":"table","name":"Name of Table 2 in Database 1","newname":"New name of Table 2"}]},{"type":"db","name":"Name of Database 2","newname":"New name of Database 2","tables":[{"type":"table","name":"Name of Table 1 in Database 2","newname":"New name of Table 1"},{"type":"table","name":"Name of Table 2 in Database 2","newname":"New name of Table 2"}]}]`

parameters.name: UsedTime
parameters.description:
The subscription duration of the new instance. Valid values:

*   If you set the **Period** parameter to **Year**, the value of the UsedTime parameter ranges from **1 to 3**.
*   If you set the **Period** parameter to **Month**, the value of the UsedTime parameter ranges from **1 to 9**.

> If you set the PayType parameter to **Prepaid**, you must also specify this parameter.

parameters.name: VPCId
parameters.description:
The ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC).

>  Make sure that the VPC belongs to the required region.

parameters.name: VSwitchId
parameters.description:
The ID of the vSwitch. The vSwitch must belong to the zone that is specified by **ZoneId**.

*   If you set **InstanceNetworkType** to **VPC**, you must also specify this parameter.
*   If you specify the **ZoneSlaveId1** parameter, you must specify the IDs of two vSwitches for this parameter and separate the IDs with a comma (,).

parameters.name: ZoneId
parameters.description:
The zone ID of the primary instance. You can call the DescribeRegions operation to query the zone ID.

>  Set this value to the zone ID of the original instance.

parameters.name: ZoneIdSlave1
parameters.description: The zone ID of the secondary instance. If you set the ZoneIdSlave1 parameter and the **ZoneId** parameter to the same value, the single-zone deployment method is used. If you set the ZoneIdSlave1 parameter and the **ZoneId** parameter to different values, the multi-zone deployment method is used.

parameters.name: ZoneIdSlave2
parameters.description: The zone ID of the logger instance. If you set the ZoneIdSlave2 parameter to the same value as the **ZoneId** parameter, the single-zone deployment method is used. If you set the ZoneIdSlave2 parameter to a different value from the **ZoneId** parameter, the multi-zone deployment method is used.
